alert.note: Alert for Benton; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 9:10PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BUCHANAN...NORTHEASTERN BENTON...SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE AND NORTHWESTERN LINN COUNTIES... At 907 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Walker, or 13 miles northeast of Vinton, moving northeast at 45 mph. At 905 PM CDT, Urbana Fire and Rescue reported hail the size of quarters in Urbana. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Troy Mills around 915 PM CDT. Quasqueton around 920 PM CDT. Winthrop, Monti and Robinson around 925 PM CDT. Winthrop Golf Course around 930 PM CDT. Masonville around 935 PM CDT. Manchester, Coffins Grove Park, Manchester Airport and Delaware County Fairgrounds around 940 PM CDT. Dundee around 945 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lime Creek County Park, Monti, Coffins Grove Park, Winthrop Golf Course, Robinson, Baileys Ford Park, Spencers Grove, Minne Estema Park, Delaware County Fairgrounds and Manchester Airport. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Iowa. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
